Carn an Righ

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Carn an Righ is a steep-sided mountain in the heart of the Mounth. It is usually climbed via the Spittal of Glenshee to the southeast.

 You have not climbed Carn an Righ.

Region: Perthshire

Altitude: 1029 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.71/5
Rating: 2.7/5 (59 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Glas Tulaichean and Carn an Righ from the Spittal of Glenshee

Other routes and challenges

Carn an Righ lies in a close-knit group of Munros - not just Glas Tulaichean, but also Beinn Iutharn Mhor and An Socach, so a variety of combinations are possible, including much longer ones from Glen Dee and Glen Clunie.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Perthshire Hotels

Perthshire B&B

Perthshire Cottages

Perthshire Hostels

There are 3687 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Carn an Righ. They have contributed 65 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first.
